title: 'Multiple' people killed, dozens injured as dust storm causes major pileup
description: Multiple people are dead and dozens injured after a massive pileup Monday in Illinois caused by a sudden dust storm, officials said.

title: Investors sue Adidas over Kanye West partnership, fallout
description: Investors have filed a class-action lawsuit against Adidas over its partnership with Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, and alleged failure to disclose business risks

title: Environmental groups sue FAA over SpaceX Texas rocket launch
description: The Federal Aviation Administration is being sued by wildlife and environmental groups over SpaceX's launch of its giant rocket from Texas

title: Bride killed, groom seriously injured by suspected drunk driver hours after wedding
description: A 25-year-old woman has been arrested.

title: Feds say hospitals broke the law by refusing to provide life-saving abortion
description: The federal government says two hospitals broke the law when refusing a Missouri woman an abortion doctors said she needed to save her life.

title: 4 killed in overnight mass shooting in Mojave Desert community
description: The Kern County Sheriff's Office is investigating an overnight mass shooting that left four dead in Mojave, CA.

title: 2 inmates, including man arrested in deputy's murder, escape from jail
description: Alder Marin-Sotelo, 26, and Bruce Callahan, 44, escaped over the weekend from the Piedmont Regional Jail in Farmville, Virginia.

title: 'Cheers' bar, 'Tonight Show' set among TV history at auction
description: A dizzying number of props, sets and costumes from television shows beloved by generations of viewers will be sold at auction next month

title: First Republic Bank fails: Was it a bailout?
description: The First Republic rescue included $50 billion in financing from a U.S. agency.

title: UN agency suspends food aid to Ethiopia's Tigray amid theft
description: The United Nations food relief agency has suspended aid deliveries to Ethiopia’s northern Tigray region amid an internal investigation into the theft of food meant for hungry people, according to four humanitarian workers

title: American Airlines, seeking new contract, vote to OK strike
description: Pilots at American Airlines are voting to authorize a strike

title: Montana trans lawmaker Zooey Zephyr sues state over censure
description: Montana lawmaker Zooey Zephyr, who is transgender, has sued the state over censure.

title: Good Samaritan jumps into action after 3-year-old boy gets shot
description: A teacher and fellow mom is recounting the moment she jumped into action to help a 3-year-old boy who was shot in Philadelphia.

title: UN envoy says Sudan's warring sides agree to negotiate
description: The United Nations’ top official in Sudan says the country's warring generals have agreed to send representatives for negotiations, which could potentially take place in Saudi Arabia

title: Gold Medal flour recalled over salmonella concerns
description: Four types of all-purpose flour from Gold Medal were voluntarily recalled due to possible salmonella contamination.

title: LGBTQ+ lawmaker to GOP: 'I’m literally trying to exist'
description: There are more than 200 LGBTQ+ lawmakers across the country, and they're increasingly finding themselves fighting against bills that target their communities

title: Mexico immigration agency head to stand trial in deadly fire
description: A judge has ordered the head of Mexico’s immigration agency to stand trial on charges that he failed in his responsibility to protect those in his custody when 40 migrants died in a fire at a border detention center in March

title: WATCH:  Beautiful mammatus clouds over Austin
description: Mammatus clouds appeared above Austin as severe storms swept south central Texas.

title: Biden hosts Philippines leader Marcos as China tensions grow
description: Biden is set to host President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. of the Philippines.

title: Fraught U.S-Israel ties on display as Knesset reconvenes
description: Israeli lawmakers reconvene Monday after a month-long parliament recess, resuming the fight over a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary that has split Israelis and drawn concern from Israel’s most important ally, the United States

title: First Republic bank collapses, JPMorgan to take over FDIC says
description: JPMorgan Chase is set to take on “all of the deposits and substantially all of the assets of First Republic Bank” after the FDIC confirmed that the bank had collapsed.

title: Alibaba's Jack Ma turns up in Japan as college professor
description: Alibaba Group founder Jack Ma will be a visiting professor at Tokyo College, a research institute run by the prestigious University of Tokyo

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers' Shaquil Barrett's 2-year-old daughter drowns in swimming pool
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers linebacker Shaquil Barrett’s 2-year-old daughter has drowned in a swimming pool at the Pro Bowl player's Tampa Bay residence.

title: Weight loss company Jenny Craig to shut down corporate offices
description: Weight loss giant Jenny Craig is planning to shutter its corporate offices and likely transition to an e-commerce company as early as Friday.
